newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sri Lanka buys diesel, jet from Vitol in Jun tender. [CORRECTED 10:55 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka buys diesel, jet from Vitol in Jun tender. [CORRECTED 10:55 GMT]

text.p: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp (CPC) bought by tender gas oil at 14 cents per barrel discount (corrects from "premium") to Singapore spot quotes and jet fuel at a 5-cents discount (corrects from "premium"), cost-and-freight (c-and-f) Colombo, a CPC source said on Friday.
Dutch trader Vitol sold the 250,000-barrels of 1.0-percent sulphur gas oil and 50,000 barrels of jet fuel for June 1-2 delivery, he said.
Tne tender which closed on May 14, attracted seven offers.

In its last tender, CPC bought from Glencore 230,000 barrels of diesel at a 38-cents premium and 40,000 barrels of 95-octane leaded gasoline at a $1.85 premium to Singapore spot quotes for May 21-22 delivery, c-and-f Colombo.
